xml-char-classes

Regular expressions for matching against the XML Character Classes

Install

sh $ npm install --save xml-char-classes

Usage

```js var xmlCharClasses = require(‘xml-char-classes’);

console.log(xmlCharClasses.digit); //=> /[0-9\u0660-\u0669\u06F0-\u06F9\u0966-\u096F\u09E6-\u09EF\u0A66-\u0A6F\u0AE6-\u0AEF\u0B66-\u0B6F\u0BE7-\u0BEF\u0C66-\u0C6F\u0CE6-\u0CEF\u0D66-\u0D6F\u0E50-\u0E59\u0ED0-\u0ED9\u0F20-\u0F29]/

xmlCharClasses.letter.test(‘unicorn’); //=> true

xmlCharClasses.letter.test(‘#’); //=> false ```

API

xmlCharClasses

Contains the following regular expressions for matching the different character classes in the XML spec.

  • letter
  • baseChar
  • ideographic
  • combiningChar
  • digit
  • extender
